text: The Inn at Lincoln Park is a hotel at 601 W. Diversey in Chicago's Lincoln Park neighborhood. ==History== Originally called the Bentmere Hotel, the building was built in 1916 at a cost of $150,000."Some New Chicago Beauty Spots", Chicago Tribune. March 5, 1916. p. 24.Chase, Al. "Plan Diversey Parkway Hotel to Cover Block", Chicago Tribune. November 19, 1921. p. 14. It was designed by Robert C. Berlin and was originally owned by Leon A. Bentley.The American Contractor. Vol. 37, No. 10. March 4, 1916. p. 54. Retrieved April 13, 2020. Vincent Drucci resided at the Bentmere for a time.Keefe, Rose (2003). Guns and Roses: The Untold Story of Dean O'Banion, Chicago's Big Shot Before Al Capone. Cumberland House Publishing. p. 243. Retrieved April 15, 2020. By the 1990s, the building was a Comfort Inn,"Prior illness may have killed student", Chicago Tribune. May 20, 1996. Section 2, p. 3. and by 2004, it was the Inn at Lincoln Park.Roeder, David. "Condo complex touted for Lincoln Park parcel", Chicago Sun-Times. July 21, 2004. p. 69.Jeffers, Glenn. "Rooms with a neighborhood view", Chicago Tribune. May 18, 2006. Retrieved April 17, 2020. Plans to demolish the building and construct a new larger hotel were put forward in 2004 and 2014, and faced significant community opposition.Roeder, David; Spielman, Fran. "Owner plans bigger Lincoln Park hotel - Wants to tear down Inn and replace it with 192-room building", Chicago Sun-Times. February 20, 2004. p. 66.Biasco, Paul. "Hampton Inn the Third Major Development Slated for Diversey Block", DNAinfo. December 17, 2014. Retrieved April 27, 2020.Butler, Patrick. "Despite neighborhood opposition, plans for new hotel at 601 W. Diversey moving forward", Inside- Booster.
